data.title: File watching doesn't work between shared folders (parallels)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #29478

I'm not getting file events for a Parallels shared folder from macOS to Linux 32 bits, independently of multi root. It doesn't seem to be a regression, since it fails on both the old and new file watchers.

data.title: Node 7 sends ASCII control characters not handled by the TerminalDecoder
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: insider
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

- node 7.4.0
- typescript installed locally
- tasks.json
```ts
{
    "version": "2.0.0",

    // we want to run npm
    "command": "npm",

    "type": "shell",

    "presentation": {
        "reveal": "never"
    },
    "group": { "kind": "build", "isPrimary": true },

    // we run the custom script "compile" as defined in package.json
    "args": ["run", "compile", "--loglevel", "silent"],

    // The tsc compiler is started in watching mode
    "isBackground": true,

    // use the standard tsc in watch mode problem matcher to find compile problems in the output.
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
}
```
- TS file and tsconfig.json
- run the task

Observe: the spinner never quits. The reason is that node 7.x sends an ASCII control sequence like 27]...BEL which is not handled by the terminal decoder.
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Multi root workspace explorer is not getting updated
data.body:
Testing #29478

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10746682/27589705-9bb8adae-5b4c-11e7-82fe-b6951ee6c18d.png)


- Set up a multi root workspace (Eg: vscode & vscode-docs) 
- vscode-docs repository has incoming changes
- Pull changes in vscode-docs repo from another Editor (VS Code stable or terminal)

Expected above multi root workspace is updated with new additions/deletions of files. But not.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10746682/27589682-8d6a25f2-5b4c-11e7-84a2-57c60e30a6ca.png)

data.title: Comment placeholder no longer centered
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (c854b698d2af794a0a3c6645133b48b776e58a28, 2017-06-27T09:29:47.979Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.9.1
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.1
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
project-manager|ale|0.18.1
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7
tslint|eg2|0.15.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
Angular2|joh|2.3.3
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.4.1
angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17
stylelint|shi|0.25.0
ayu|tea|0.4.0
change-case|wma|1.0.0

(4 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. on a blank line, invoke a comment (`command-/`)
2. The comment is added, but the insertion point is against the opening comment, with 2 spaces before the closing comment: `<!--|  -->`
3. It used to be centered:  `<!-- | -->`

![jun-27-2017 09-16-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835148/27589555-d845f2fa-5b19-11e7-9462-1fc6be2de4c5.gif)


This requires me to type a space, then my comment , then remove the space after my comment, so I get:  `<!-- my comment -->`

This may seem pedantic, but it's more readable this way, and it's a regression as it worked correctly for months.

var teste = { prop1: 'teste' };

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Respect search.exclude per folder
data.body:
Refs: #29510

1. Have a multi root folder setup (for example one of the non master folders is vscode)
2. Full text search in vscode and notice that you get results inside node_modules, not respecting the `search.exclude` in `settings.json` of the vscode folder

For instance if you search for 'debug' the search will never finish due to the inifinite node modules inisde vscode

data.title: Cannot quit quick pick and accessible diff view on single Escape
data.body:
Got that problem when testing #29496.

1. Enter screen reader mode
2. Press F1 to enter quick pick menu.
3. Try to close with Esc.
Single Esc does not work, but pressing it second time closes quick pick menu.

Same happens when entering accessible diff view, that requires pressing Esc twice to exit diff view.

data.title: Small exit button in diff review panel
data.body:
Testing #29496

In themes (incl. High Contrast theme) close button (cross in top right corner) is barely visible. 

Maybe it's worth to make the quit-cross bigger if some people use high contrast together with screen reader?

data.title: Select for Compare explorer action is broken when having multiple roots

Testing #29478

It don't do a damn thing.

data.title: Tasks>Terminate Tasks/Restart Tasks - tell the user when there are no tasks to terminate/restart
data.body:
Testing #29442

The action currently does nothing when there is no running task. The action should inform the user that there is no task to terminate/restart.

data.title: Do not refresh explorer more than necessary, upon file events
data.body:
Testing #29478

Currently, regardless of the file event, the whole explorer is refreshed.

data.title: files.watcherExclude needs explanation of values
data.body:
Testing #29478

I couldn't get the `files.watcherExclude` settings to work unless I prefixed by globs with `**/`. None of these work as expected:

- `README.md`
- `src/README.md`
- `src/**`

data.title: Tasks 2.0.0: presentation is not allowed as a global property
github issues extension: Clicking or double clicking on an issue has no effect
data.body:
Testing #29507:

Clicking or double clicking on an issue has no effect.
I have to use the context action "Open Issue" instead.

Is this really the intended behaviour?

data.title: Missing file events on Linux 64
data.body:
Ref: #29478
Linux 64 bit VM, note that @joaomoreno can not repro for linux 32bit

1. Multi root folder setup
2. Delete or add a file in the master folder undearneth vscode
3. Notice VSCode explorer is not picking up that change. I have debugged the explorer and I see that I am not getting file events
4. I am getting file events for some folders sometimes, so this seems to be a bit random

data.title: We need a better context menu contribution story
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29466

- fresh workspace
- open context menu on an empty explorer

You get:

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1931590/27587110-53e84970-5b43-11e7-9786-3a1df20cea06.png)

Most of the actions are not applicable. They should be either disabled or preferable not be there at all.

data.body: Title says it all.

data.title: VSCode removes folder from "recent list" if it is on Network Drive
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS 1.12

**VSCode removes folder from "recent list" if it is on Network Drive and not connected, if it is connected it doesnt appear again. It should stay here all the time.**

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Connect any SAMBA (smb) network drive
2. Open folder on VS Code from SAMBA
3. Close VS Code
4, Disconnect SAMBA
5, Open VS Code
6, Connect SAMBA
7, Try to open project, from Welcome screen or File > Open recent (Folder is missing here)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Ctrl+Delete deletes whitespace plus token in vs-keybindings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.3.4|
|vscode-nuget-package-manager|jmrog|1.1.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|vs-keybindings|ms-vscode|0.1.6|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file with whitespace at the beginning of a line and then some text like a method signature, etc.
2. Move your cursor to the beginning of the line and press Ctrl+Delete.
3. The expected behavior would be to delete the whitespace up to the first token but what really happens is the whitespace plus the first token are deleted.
4. I disabled all extensions and reloaded and the issue didn't reproduce, then I enabled and reloaded each extension individually until I identified it is this extension causing the issue.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Feature Request: $TM_FILENAME variable without file extension in snippets
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: OSX Sierra

I want to use only file name without file extension in my snippet.   
For sublime the solution was like this:  
`${TM_FILENAME/(.+)\..+|.*/$1/:name}`

data.title: Error when launching extension: "Sent env to running instance. Terminating..."
data.body:
testing #29511:

- installed latest generator with `npm install -g yo generator-code`
- created new JavaScript extension "hello-foo-bar" with `yo code`
- opened in VS Code
- pressed F5

got this:
![2017-06-27_13-47-44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/27586260-e5c7a18c-5b3f-11e7-9f58-eb02ed769f9a.png)
 
```
'/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/MacOS/Electron' --debugBrkPluginHost=9439 --extensionDevelopmentPath=/Users/weinand/MS/Projects/Scenarios/extensions/hello-foo-bar 
2017-06-27 13:46:53.903 Electron[55944:6683699] ApplePersistence=YES
Error: Sent env to running instance. Terminating...
    at /Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:313579
    at Object.v [as _notify] (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:67277)
    at Object.enter (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:70842)
    at n.Class.derive._creator._run (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:72670)
    at n.Class.derive._creator._completed (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:72111)
    at Object.v [as _notify] (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:67277)
    at Object.enter (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:70842)
    at n.Class.derive._oncancel._run (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:72670)
    at n.Class.derive._oncancel._completed (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:72111)
    at Object.v [as _notify] (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:67277)
```

After that the extension was running fine and I could trigger the Hello command and hit breakpoints.

data.title: Should TypeScript build task be a watch task?
data.body:
Currently the TypeScript build task is a normal compile. We could consider using a watch task instead since this gives us compile one save. Downside is that tsc -watch doesn't work well with large projects.

@egamma do you have a opinion ?

data.title: Typescript build task should prefer bundled tsc/tsserver over global one
data.body:
We should consider bundling tsc.js with the typescript extension and call that version if the user uses the bundled tsserver instead of the global installed one

This makes the story more consistent with the errors the user sees from the tsserver.

data.title: Word wrap settings ('on') are completely ignored
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|fresh-material|2ndshift|2.2.1|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.15.2|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.18.1|
|htmltagwrap|bradgashler|0.0.3|
|gotemplate|casualjim|0.1.1|
|bracket-pair-colorizer|CoenraadS|0.10.7|
|mustache|dawhite|1.0.0|
|gitlens|eamodio|4.2.0|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.7|
|json-tools|eriklynd|1.0.2|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|automagic-code|jairzjunior|0.0.2|
|theme-material-dark-soda|jbw91|1.2.0|
|theme-atomic-dark|kimkwanka|0.2.0|
|git-indicators|lamartire|1.2.1|
|vs-color-picker|lihui|0.6.0|
|start-git-bash|McCarter|1.2.1|
|code-beautifier|michelemelluso|1.7.2|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|atom-keybindings|ms-vscode|2.9.0|
|subtle-brackets|rafamel|2.0.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.10.1|
|vscode-theme-superonedark|seansassenrath|0.0.15|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.8.1|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.5.5|
|vscode-material-syntax-dark|woodywoodsta|0.1.1|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.9|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an editor (i.e. js file)
2. Type code normally
3. Go to a website and copy HTML text
4. Return to editor and paste text
5. Pasted text ignores word wrap settings!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14346320/27585690-2e072888-5b35-11e7-860f-2cab691ec92f.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14346320/27585749-5a1ffe86-5b35-11e7-9176-c04f79624e54.png)
